Stern School of Business      Liberal Studies Program      NYU Abu Dhabi      NYU Shanghai      Polytechnic School of Engineering      Robert F. Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                                        go                                                    New York University              New York University              Information Technology Services                                                 About ITS                               Get Connected                             Your NetID & Password                          IT Service Catalog                          Connect On-Campus                          Connect Off-Campus                          Connect at the Global Sites                           NYU Smart Phones & Mobile Devices                               Software                          ITS Accounts                                           Communicate & Collaborate                               Help & Support                                 Computer Security                               Instruction & Research                               Locations & Facilities                                                                         Home           //        Get Connected                 //         NYU Smart Phones & Mobile Devices                                               NYU Smart Phones & Mobile Devices                                                       search the site                                                                           forms      To request a new smart phone, or add services to your current smart phone, please download and fill out one of the carrier-specific forms:     AT&T   Verizon        did you know?            It is possible to use a variety of smart phones      to access NYU resources, but ITS' support for smart phones is currently      limited to BlackBerry, Android, and iPhone. If you own a different brand, it      may be possible to use portions of these instructions to configure      your smart phone.          NYU Mobile is NYU's official app for iOS and Android devices, offering real-time      shuttle tracking, university events, campus map, contact information from the NYU      Directory, University news, and more. For additional information and instructions on downloading     the app, visit www.nyu.edu/mobile .                     ITS provides basic information for NYU faculty, staff, and administrators on requesting an NYU-purchased smart phone    (such as an iPhone, BlackBerry, or Android device) and mobile devices (such as the iPad and iPod Touch) and configuring it to    access NYU resources such as email, calendaring, NYURoam wireless access, and VPN.     Eligibility    Requesting a mobile device    Available models, billing and plans    ITS support for mobile devices       Step-by-Step Guides          Eligibility   Eligibility for an NYU-purchased smart phone or mobile device, and the policy for using the device, is determined by the head of your division. All requests for an NYU-purchased devices must be approved before the request is submitted to ITS.   Requesting a mobile device   To request a new smart phone, please download and fill out one of the carrier-specific forms below. ITS recommends recent models of iPhone, Android, or BlackBerry devices.       AT&T     Verizon       Once you have filled out one of the above forms, received departmental approval, and have all the necessary signatures, please scan and email the form to its.mobile@nyu.edu . Orders take five to seven business days to arrive. ITS will contact you when the phone is ready.    Billing and plan options   For an overview of billing and plan options, see the ServiceLink knowledge base: Mobile Devices (ITS): Billing and plans .    ITS support for mobile devices    ITS provides online and phone support for using your device with NYU enterprise technology services. If you are an NYU staff or faculty member, and your department has determined that you are eligible for an NYU-issued mobile device, ITS Mobile can help acquire and activate it for you. See the FAQs page for details about the services, devices, and support that ITS Mobile offers. If you are ready to request a device, you can download one of the device-specific forms (see the right-hand sidebar) and email a scan of the completed, signed form to its.mobile@nyu.edu .    If you are an NYU staff or faculty member, your department or program may participate in a service which provides for on-site and in-person smart phone support. Please visit the ITS Desktop Support page for more information.      Step-by-Step Guides   For instructions on activating and configuring your device to check and send NYU Email, synchronize with your desktop address book, browse the web, and more, see the Initial Setup tab .    Important Note : Because instructions change frequently and can vary from device to device and between  wireless carriers (AT&T, Verizon, etc.), it's important  that you rely on the product- and network-specific instructions that  come with your device and are given to you by the carrier you chose.  ITS' guides are intended only to provide basic information about using your  smart phone at NYU, and may not reflect the most recent information from your wireless carrier and/or device manufacturer.    Page last reviewed: October 25, 2013

Wagner Graduate School of Public Service      School of Continuing and Professional Studies      School of Law      School of Medicine      Silver School of Social Work      Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development      Tisch School of the Arts                                         Search        go                                                               New York University              New York University              Office of the Bursar                                                               eSuite Information                                       Payment Information                                     Loans and NY State Tap Awards                                     Tuition and Fees                                     Your Account                                     Refunds                                      Tax Topics                                           Forms                                           Services                                               Home        |         Housing Deposit                                                              Housing Reservation Payment:      The $1,000 Housing Reservation Payment is non-refundable/non-transferable and required for most housing applicants. In addition to completing the NYU Housing Application students should make their payments by the following deadlines:        Spring 2015 applicants - November 20, 2014 (priority deadline)       Academic Year 2015-2016 NYU-NY returning undergraduate students - March 12, 2015       Academic Year 2015-2016 new in-coming students - May 1, 2015     Academic Year 2015-2016 Study Away students - May 1, 2015        Pay online via eDeposit:    (Students have a single sign-on to the NYU eSuite through the Albert "NYU Housing Payments link" via NYUHome. A student's NetID and password are required.)          To log on to eSuite and make the deposit, please follow these instructions:           Log onto NYUHome with your Net ID and password     Click the ACADEMICS tab     Click ALBERT LOGIN     Click the “NYU Housing Payments” link     Click the “Continue to eSuite link,” (this will log you into eSuite)     Click the “eDeposits” Tab at the top of the page.                  How students can invite parents to access eSuite and make payment       Pay via check:       Pay by Personal Check or Money Order    If mailing your payment, please also complete the Housing Coupon          Pay via Wire Transfer: (for payment from non-U.S. bank accounts)       Pay by Wire Transfer        Please contact the Housing Office 212-998-4600 or housing@nyu.edu if you have any questions regarding your Housing Reservation Fee or Application
